intro: Yulania pendula, commonly known as the weeping chrysanthemum, is a flowering plant native to China. It is a member of the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its drooping, elongated stems that bear clusters of small, showy yellow flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 1–2 meters and thrives in well-drained soil with full sun exposure. Its unique cascading form makes it a popular ornamental plant in gardens and landscapes. Yulania pendula is also valued for its ability to attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
